primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Son of God enters the world to engage the 'ruler of this world' in a cosmic battle on the cross to complete the work of salvation and create a new humanity.

tekstueel_bewijs: He will engage and dislodge the Enemy in battle
He loved them to the end

object.identificatie: The completion of the Father's work (Salvation/New Humanity)
tekstueel_bewijs: the work that the Father gave the Son to accomplish
the work that the Father gave the Son to accomplish
I do as the Father has commanded me
reveals the true and complete destiny of humanity and the creation
to all who receive him, he has given power
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver/Beneficiary of a completed action.

tekstueel_bewijs: in the power of the Spirit
these are written... that you may come to believe
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Spirit is the internal power of the Subject.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power for the Subject's performance.

tekstueel_bewijs: the Evil One, the demonic usurper
the forces of evil arrayed against him
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a moral failing but a 'nihilistic swallowing up' and a 'demonic usurper' that requires a divine champion to defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preacher's task of proclaiming the Word so that the hearer may believe.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Preacher/Evangelist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (preaching) exists only to testify to the already completed primary program (the Cross).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Spirit → Jesus Christ ← The Ruler of this World

voorbeelden_god_subject: He has offered himself as the Lamb
He will draw all humanity to myself
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we have come together to reflect
you understand, or you are on the way to understanding

voorbeelden: he must first engage and dislodge the Enemy
Each one wants to tell us
he loved them to the end
Jesus knew that all was now finished
He knows what he has come to accomplish
he has given power to become children of God
He has no power over me

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) of Christ to finish the work that humans could not, and the subsequent endowment of power to the believer.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (the shriek of abandonment) to S1 (the shout of completion), mediated by the 'vindication' of the resurrection.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ entering S2 to establish S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon emphasizes that Jesus truly experienced 'the absence of God'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God (in Christ) is the sole actor of the primary verbs of salvation. The 'work' is described as finished without human contribution.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has offered himself as the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world.
the demonic usurper, the Power set against God

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples; even the disciples are depicted as receivers of Christ's love and power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric reading is already the primary mode.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and assurance; the burden of 'finishing' is removed.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: the 'Fundamental Program' of Christ's victory is the exclusive focus.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Spurgeon evokes a breathtaking image of Jesus on the cross as a great champion in a mighty contest with Satan.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the power through which the Son acts and the believer receives.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'ruler' and a 'nihilistic swallowing up' that humans cannot escape on their own.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a grace-oriented actantial structure where Christ is the Subject and humanity is the Receiver.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: None; the focus on POUVOIR (God's power) is appropriate for Good Friday.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain focus on the finished work.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the trap of exemplarism and moralism by keeping the 'active verbs' firmly in the hands of the Crucified Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'three sayings' structure, semiotics reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the cosmic Subject-switch from man to Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains 'tetelestai'; Greimas analysis shows how that word functions as the 'Object' of a divine mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Ruler of this world' is the essential Opponent that necessitates a Divine Subject, proving the sermon is not just 'about' Jesus but 'driven' by Him.

volledige_subject_lijst: He has created the new community
appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace perfectly.
